s.text: (Click here to read William Saletan's "Frame Game" on McCain's evolution.)

When all the candidates were asked about the "digital divide"--the notion that poor people and minorities are suffering from their lack of access to computers--McCain gave an answer that could have been Al Gore's, lauding efforts to connect schools and libraries to the Internet and decrying "the growing gap between the haves and have-nots in America."
The most striking thing to me about McCain of late is his continuing dalliance with American Prospect- type liberalism.
Right away, you saw the notorious smirk cross Bush's face.
Then Bush turned away from the question, as if resisting the effort to laugh in the questioner's face.
He had some effective rejoinders, such as when he told Keyes to buzz off when Keyes asked him a question about how he would handle his daughter wanting an abortion.
